content: seaming options on youtube as well as borders i m using a 21 color palette in 5 degree increments this year just so i will see a little more color change my full size legend is last page of the pattern i ve never been big on rainbows or rainbow order color palettes so my palette this year is as close as i m going to get to a rainbow it s your project make it how you like when arranging colors and determining your temperature fluctuations you will need to know your climate temperature blocks will always look best if you use all same weight/likeness of yarn mine are all yarn bee soft and sleek except one i love this yarn in linen is added to the palette once your palette is decided make a color chart showing temperature range each color will represent keep a separate notebook or calendar with temps for the day an easy way to stay on track is to keep your pattern color chart notebook/calendar of temps & one skein of each color yarn in a basket or drawer so you can pull out every 2 weeks and make your block mine are legend order in an over the door shoe organizer this year 1-2 hours every other week to stay caught up will make it easy to stick with it once a temperature block is completed be sure to number them i use safety pins with number beads on them after you block and number them throw them in a basket and you will not have to wonder what order they go in when you re ready to seam them together 4 of 9 special stitches bead stitch 1 double_crochet in st which acts as your post *yo insert hook around the post and pull up a loop * repeat * to * 2 or 3 more times until you have 7 or 9 loops on your hook yo and pull through all 7 or 9 loops each bead creates 2 sts puff around fpdc *yo insert hook under post yo pull through and pull up tall* repeat * to * three times 9 loops on the hook yo pull through all 9 loops on hook chain 1 to close tight extended front post half_double_crochet *yo insert hook under fpdc yo pull through yo pull through one loop on the hook yo pull through all 3 loops on the hook crochet in 3rd loop first loop second loop third loop 5 of 9 directions create a mc round 1 chain 4 counts as a treble_crochet place 15 treble_crochet in mc fasten_off 16 treble_crochet brownie brownie round 2 join between sts chain 1 fpdc around treble_crochet *chain 1 fpdc around next treble_crochet* repeat from * to * around slip_stitch to join first chain fasten_off 16 fpdc + 16 chain = 32 yb linen yb linen round 3 join in chain space *fpdc around fpdc bead st in chain space* repeat from * to *
